title: How to Use a Bissell Proheat Pet

steps.headline: Move the furniture out of the way so you can access the entire carpet.
steps.description: It’s important to clean the entire carpet at the same time rather than just doing individual sections. If you clean it piecemeal, the carpet will end up different shades in different spots. If you can’t get all the furniture out of the room, move everything to one side. Clean the empty side first and let the carpet completely dry. Then move the furniture to the clean side and steam the next section so that the entire carpet is done the same day.

steps.headline: Vacuum the carpet beforehand to pick up excess hair and dirt.
steps.description: Use a regular vacuum cleaner to give the entire room a thorough sweep before you use the Bissell. The more dirt, dust, and hair you can clean up beforehand, the easier it’ll be to steam clean the carpet later on. Don’t neglect the corners of the room, too! Use an attachment to get in all the corners and crevices.

steps.headline: Spray tough stains with a pretreatment cleaner before beginning.
steps.description: You can manually spray the area with a pretreatment product of your choice, or you could use Bissell’s special Pet Urine Eliminator pretreatment. Some models of the Proheat Pet have a built-in spray compartment in the back of the machine that you can load and activate by foot to disperse the spray. If you use the built-in spray compartment on your Bissell, use a Bissell specific product for the best results. Some products need several hours to saturate the carpet, so check out the instructions beforehand. This may determine if you should steam the carpet the same day or wait until the morning.

parts.name: Filling the Tanks and Turning on the Bissell

steps.headline: Fill the water tank to the waterline with hot water.
steps.description: Tap water works just fine in your Bissell cleaner, so don’t worry about using filtered or distilled water. The water tank is located on the front of the cleaner; you can detach it from the cleaner and take it to the sink to fill it up more easily. Hot water helps clean your carpet better than cold water, and it’ll also dry faster than cold water would. Make sure you securely replace the water tank on the cleaner once you’ve filled it up.

steps.headline: Prepare the formula tank by filling it with water and formula.
steps.description: The formula tank is often called the “SmartMix” tank in the user manual, and it’s located on the front of your Bissell Proheat Pet. For concentrated formulas, add 3 capfuls to the tank and fill it the rest of the way with hot water. For normal concentrations of formula, simply fill the tank to the formula line. The “formula” is just a bottle of cleaner sold by Bissell specifically meant to steam-clean your carpets. You can find it online or at most grocery and home goods stores. There’s no need to shake up the container to mix the water and formula. The Bissell will do that itself once it’s being used. Always use Bissell-specific products in your cleaner. Off-brand products can cause build-up and make the cleaner not function as well.

steps.headline: Select the desired option on the self-clean dial.
steps.description: Once the water and formula tanks are full, it’s time to choose the right cleaning option on the Bissell. There’s generally an option for “dirty,” “normal,” “light,” and “water only.” For regular cleaning, a normal or light cycle should be sufficient. For heavy stains, opt for the dirty cycle. Pet stains and high-traffic areas can get discolored and dirty pretty quickly. Try steaming them once per month to keep your carpet in the best condition possible.

steps.headline: Plug in the cleaner and turn on the heater and the power switches.
steps.description: Once the room and cleaner are ready, go ahead and plug the cord into an outlet. Find the power button and heater button near the bottom of the Bissell and press both of them. Make sure their lights turn on to indicate that they are both working. The heating function keeps the water hot as you clean. Without it, you wouldn’t get much steam.

steps.headline: Recline the Bissell by flipping the handle release at the bottom of the machine.
steps.description: On the bottom left-hand side, there is a small plastic handle you can flip down to release the body of the Bissell so that it is no longer standing upright and is easier to push back and forth. If you don’t release this handle, the machine won’t disperse water and soap and it’ll be nearly impossible to use.

steps.headline: Hold the trigger down to dispense soapy water as you steam the carpet.
steps.description: Use a forward motion like you would if you were using a vacuum cleaner. As you push the Bissell forward, hold down the trigger located on the handle so that hot soapy water is deposited into the carpet.Tip: Start at the far end of the room and work your way toward the entrance. That way, you won’t accidentally clean yourself into a corner.

steps.headline: Pull the Bissell back as you release the trigger to re-absorb the water.
steps.description: After dispensing the water, let go of the trigger on the handle and pull the cleaner back over the area in which you just deposited hot soapy water. The Bissell’s bristles will clean the carpet as it simultaneously sucks up dirty water. Continue running the Bissell forward and backward over the same spot until no more dirty water comes up. Going over the same area multiple times will get the area cleaner and also reduce how long it’ll take to dry.

steps.headline: Use the upholstery tool to clean couches, chairs, and hard-to-reach areas.
steps.description: Make sure to switch the dial from “floor cleaning” to “tools” so that the water exits the right compartment. The attachment also has a trigger that you press to release the water. Remember to go over the same area several times to suck up as much water and dirt as possible. Feel free to utilize this option any time your furniture needs a little TLC. You don’t have to wait until your carpets need to be cleaned!

steps.headline: Let the carpet dry for 2–3 hours before you replace the furniture.
steps.description: The damper the carpet, the longer it’ll take to dry. Or, if you live in a humid climate, that could also affect the drying time. Check the carpet by hand to see if it is still wet to the touch. Put up a baby gate or something similar to keep kids and pets out of the room while it’s drying. Avoid walking on the carpet or replacing furniture before it’s completely dry. If you compress wet carpet, it could permanently misshape it.Tip: Use the “Express Clean Mode” to reduce the drying time to 1 hour.

steps.headline: Check the water tank if the soap isn’t dispensing.
steps.description: The water tank needs to be filled to the line for it to work properly. It also needs to be securely in place in the cleaner. Sometimes hair or debris can get in the way, so remove the tank and wipe down the area where it locks into place. Reinsert the water tank and turn on the power to see if it will now dispense liquid. The contents of the water tank and the formula tank will mix as you clean. The soapy water won’t dispense at all if there is an issue with the water tank. Sometimes the water tank simply doesn’t have enough left in it to keep cleaning and needs to be refilled. If this is the case, you’ll probably notice that the dirty-water reservoir is looking pretty full.

steps.headline: Remove the dirty water tank and empty it if it isn’t sucking up water.
steps.description: If you notice that your cleaner has stopped sucking up water, it’s most likely because the dirty water tank is full. Or, it could be that the tank wasn’t latched firmly into place. Double-check both possibilities. The water tank and the dirty water tank are generally located in the same place. Most Bissell water tanks have an interior compartment that is for the clean water, and the dirty water gets sucked up into a compartment that surrounds the clean one. You may also need to clean or wipe off the red filter that is underneath the water tank. If that is clogged, the dirty water won’t be able to get sucked up into the tank.

steps.headline: Make sure the cleaner is reclined if the brush roll isn’t moving.
steps.description: If you try to operate the Bissell while it’s in an upright position, it won’t work. Use your foot to release the upright part of the cleaner so it’s in a reclined position. The reclined position also makes it a lot easier to push and pull back and forth. You can also check the brush roll to see if something is stuck in it, like an elastic, a big clump of dirt, or something else. The roll should spin easily when you move it by hand—if it doesn’t, that means something is lodged in there.

steps.headline: Clean the front nozzle and bristles if they are clogged.
steps.description: The front nozzle is the section that both releases water and sucks it back up. Sometimes it can get clogged and prevent the machine from doing what it’s supposed to. Lift the piece of plastic that covers the bristles. Use the provided brush cleaner to wipe away dirt that is attached to the bristles, and rinse the plastic in warm water before replacing it. You may notice that it takes longer for your cleaner to suck up dirty water than it used to. This is a common result of the nozzle or bristles getting weighed down with dirt.
